title: So Yorick...
body:
There is much to say about Yorick, and I'm gonna quote this guy who worded it very well.


>  Let's take this opportunity to call out what a massive blunder Yorick is. This is not directed at you per se as it is not your fault at all, but Yorick is the worst handled moba character since the Gambler. He is permabanned from the free week rotation, he is constantly the culprit behind spaghetti code breaking the game (unlimited deaths in a game, dropping games every other patch, etc.), no skins released, perma "on the remake to do list."
 Lets be completely frank here, why has he not been #1 on the redo list? Why has Gangplank now received 2 visual updates while Yorick, who is not in a sorry visual state in my opinion, will not get a skin because he is "on the VU list?

>  -Nazzdan

replies.body:
This guy gets it.

As someone who loves Yorick (I know it's weird, but I like his kit, despite the fact that it is just a sloppy mess), he REALLY needs an overhaul. While I can understand that some characters also need a complete reworking (eg. Poppy, Fiora, and a myriad of others), Yorick has been one of, if not, the biggest issue in the game. Being **permabanned from the Free Rotation** almost seems like a joke, or something that you tell newer or ignorant players just to see their reaction as they discover that it's true.

And really, the quote brings up a good point, GP went through 2 reworks - Granted, his first rework was a visual change, and goddamn did he need it, stupid banana sword - while Yorick just hangs out, skinless as well (Ha! Zombie joke!).

Here's hoping that he gets looked at soon, but everything I've seen points to Poppy, Taric and Fiora getting their upgrades first. And that really is the great irony of the whole situation, isn't it? One of his prevailing quotes is "You will remember Yorick Mori!" and yet he's been long forgotten, with no one but a few faithful community members to talk about him.

Yeah I wanted to clarify I also really like Yorick, both kit-wise and thematically.  He by no means is the most dated character visually, he still looks fine.  
The problem is entirely how his kit is coded, because for some reason every patch seems to have an issue where a new AP item is released and somehow that makes Yorick's ult drop games.  Or a new game mode is released, and for some reason that makes Yoricks rez as soon as they die only to die again over and over.  A new champion is released, but when Yorick ults them the game just ends and everyone that was in it is suddenly catapulted to challenger.
The fact that he is never on free-week is ridiculous.  At this point he should just be given away for free from some stupid promotion like Alistar, Garen and Tristana.  That way we could at least say "well, hes not on free week because he is free!  yay!"
I would be perfectly content if they just re-released him with the exact same kit, maybe polished his looks a bit, and made it so he doesn't break the game every 2 weeks.
It's been said in this thread already but he had a Rioter working on him that was VERY transparent with the community, bouncing ideas off of people in the threads.  Then whoops, he got pulled off and now Yorick is at the very bottom of the rework list again.  It's warwick all over again

I won't lie, when I saw your username, I immediately went "Hey, it's the guy from the original post! Neat!"

Xelnath _was_ working on Yorick a long while ago, and he had some really cool ideas - one in particular was his idea for an ult where Yorick summoned like 20 ghouls to attack the enemies, it sounded awesome - but then Xel literally disappeared off the face of the planet. Before he completely vanished, he said Yorick was being put in the icebox until later, and then into the aether went both Xel and Yorick. Legend says they're still there, frolicking in the aether flower fields that I assume exist. 

At this point, by the time we get a reworked zombie guy, an actual zombie apocalypse may occur before we get it.

I feel you on this, and agree that he is in dire need of an update. That said, we want to take the time to do him right and he is in early stages of gameplay design, concepting, and lore work. 

Don't expect him to come out before Poppy/Taric (both are much farther along), but do know that we are working on him and we are not gonna put it down until we finish. Yorick can be soooo much more than he is and I hope that you will like the results when he's finally rebuilt from the ground up.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fraJT3AA,comment-id=000f,timestamp=2015-07-18T21:59:17.522+0000)
>
> I feel you on this, and agree that he is in dire need of an update. That said, we want to take the time to do him right and he is in early stages of gameplay design, concepting, and lore work. 

Question:  More than two years ago, [Xelnath started a Yorick gameplay update in the old forums](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3605329&page=1) that was well received by players before he ["turned it over to you."](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3605329&page=406)

What exactly happened to that proposal?  Did you lose it or forget it?  Did Xelnath get bored and not want to pursue it?  Did you "Skarner" the plan right from the start?
 
> Don't expect him to come out before Poppy/Taric (both are much farther along), but do know that we are working on him and we are not gonna put it down until we finish. Yorick can be soooo much more than he is and I hope that you will like the results when he's finally rebuilt from the ground up.

It's been **more than four years** since Yorick's release and you're just getting started on him (at least [that's what you said 3 months ago](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/9tNOPRJQ-update-for-the-champion-update-schedule?comment=000300010001) when you last spoke at length about him).

To put this in perspective, the long panned "stealth rework" from mid 2012 took _less than three years_ from the initial announcement to get finished and released.  This, among many other reasons, is why "Soon™" became a meme about Riot's internal time schedules.

So, how much longer are we going to have to wait until you get some real work started him?  Poppy and Taric, from what I've heard, aren't nearly close to being ready nearly a year after Sion was finished and Urgot is supposed the next major rework after them.

There's "waiting to get it right," and then there's procrastination at this unforgivable level and I hope I'm not still playing in July 2017 and you tell us...

>"Hey guys, we're working hard on finishing the Quinn & Valor rework, but we'll get Yorick up to you as soon as he's ready."

The pain is real, and you're not doing much to alleviate it with these shallow words.

After Xelnath stopped working on yorick we didn't end up picking it back up until very recently (march ish if I remember correctly, ah you linked it too). We definitely used some of his work as a starting point and have continued iterating from there.
Interesting he can fit in the juggernaut class?

Unless they decide to push him back towards the necromancer who always had a little controllable army of ghouls with him as he was always meant to be, which would be cool (would really need them to finally implement proper minion controls though which at this point I don't think they have any intention of doing).

Do him justice Riot! We know you can!
If Sion was any indicator of what their heavier-handed updates are going to look like, it may take a damned eternity, but it'll be good when it finally comes around.

He mentioned in another thread that the super large scale ones take about 8 months minimum, sometimes longer. they Put Yorick back onto the champion update list as a current project back at (I think) the beginning of June, so I wouldn't expect him to be done until spring of next year *at the earliest*.
Is there anywhere posted by whoever is working on him the ideas they are thinking up?

Near the end of season 3, one Rioter was putting together a fine rework for him. He was heavily interacting with the community, he proposed multiple kits and had fans vote on which one they liked better, and he asked the important questions like "Why do you play Yorick" and "What parts of his kit are fun, and which are boring?". Unfortunately, this back and forth process between Rioter and players took so long that when a kit was finally decided on the Rioter got called off the project to work on the season 4 pre-season changes, and the rework got shelved.

However, Riot hasn't forgotten about the rework, or at least knows of it's existence. I know this because one of the newer items is {{item:3512}}, which functions very similarly to the proposed reworked Yorick ult that put down a gravestone on the map and had ghouls constantly spawn from it to attack/siege things.

Yorick is probably going to require a {{champion:14}} level rework; new kit, new voice, new look, new splash, the whole nine yards. It's basically making a new champion. That takes time, but when a champion is such a problem to the game as Yorick is, it would be worth the expenditure. If they started now they _might_ have something just in time for the Harrowing.

Personally, I hope he stays a minion master type of champion and also a tanky one as well. There's other champs that have pets in the game, but they're all squishy as hell. Yorick is a bruiser that leads his ghouls into battle, not hides behind them like {{champion:268}} or {{champion:74}}.
... for the next arrowing, you mean?

Because they guy (apparantly singular) who's working on it keeps getting pulled to other projects.

Edit: I just looked up the Gambler. Goddamn, I thought Yorick was bad.

http://i.imgur.com/xrmjVZl.jpg

This DotA classic champion. He was so bad he was actually removed. I almost feel like they were _trying_ to make a horribly designed champion.
That is literally the stupidest skillset ever.

Before IceFrog came around, there were some even stupider heroes. Void Demon, Astral Trekker, Fanadin, Original Invoker, Death Ward Riki, and the grand-daddy of all broken as hell designs: "The Dark Terminator," who could only be accessed by repicking a hero after you've already chosen one. But damn was he broken.

Gambler was only the tip of the iceberg. Both DotA and League have come a long way from those terrible designs.

That's just so stupid. Why would you ever want a skillset that damages yourself/your team that hard?!

{{champion:223}} notwithstanding.

But he is on the rework list, and they have expressed great interest in him, and he has work being done currently, but people think everything at Riot is on a single track setup, when multiple reworks are being worked on by various people at different stages, he just simply isn't ready yet.

Gangplank is a key champion in the upcoming event of course he would get priority, he is also much easier and quicker to fix, that's why Ms Fortune got her gameplay update alongside him.

I love Yorick but he has a 0.81% pick rate he isn't something they need to prioritize as heavily as others want.

Yorick's rework has been slated for over 2 years now. Or should I say AT LEAST 2 years, when apparently it's been in concept stages since at least 2012. He's skipped two Harrowings as key events for his re-work. And we're going to hit Harrowing 2015, and soonafter 2016.

Sounds like the potential for a solid 4 year rework. And this game was released in, what, 2009?

Yorick will have technically spent over half of LoL's current lifespan in the process of "being re-worked".

Ayy, but y'know, "they've expressed great interest in him" is always a nice thought.

Didn't it take several years for them to get to Heimerdinger? And several years for them to get to Eve and Twitch (of whom, Eve's rework is considered a dramatic failure and is slated for yet another one)? And several years to get to Sion?

Point being: Riot doesn't have a good track record for "fast" reworks. I agree that he needs a much faster rework, but we have to remember who we're dealing with here: A sloppily coded mess of a champion and a company that takes years to make good on promises of reworks.

Yorick's rework has objectively taking the longest amount of time out of any re-work that has ever been announced. Hovering at over 3 years and drastically heading to 4 is something that is outright ridiculous for something that has supposedly been prioritized the entire time. Which it hasn't. They obviously haven't.

RiotScruffy himself said he's still in concepting.

THREE YEARS FOR CONCEPTING.

I don't think we're getting Yorick before 2017 at this point.

I already said they were slow. I don't know what part of that you apparently took offense to. Yorick is a mess of coding and Riot has slow reworks. I legitimately don't know why you needed to repeat that.

I wasn't defending them, I called them out in an off-hand manner for being so goddamn slow. He has been on the rework table since not long after his release - he was bullshit then, he's bullshit now. Even though he has his fans, and that's completely fine, I imagine most of them would want Riot to speed the shit up already. This is pitifully slow. 

Heimerdinger took a long time, but it wasn't 4 years. Twitch and Eve took a long time, but it didn't take 4 years. Sion took a long time and it took... Actually, I'd have to go back and find when they started his rework, I'm certain he took a pretty damn long time, too. Years, certainly, but that's all I know off the top of my head.

Your response comes off as "look at these other reworks Riot did. This is the standard for rework duration." It's kind of easy to misunderstand your post as more of a defense of Riot's processes than an attack on them.

Derp.

To be honest, Heimerdinger was only remade to **try** and stop the Q turrets he would just put down again and again. Twitch only gained a huge VU, no changes to the kit. Evelynn has not even been touched (unless you want to add in her balance changes they didn't really do anything to). Sion is the only one who got new abilities and a new look (therefore, a whole new champion). I honestly like how Yorick is now, but that's just me. If they do change him, I'd miss the pets he'd be able to summon. Its my only work around for the few pro Rivens out there.

Eve hasn't been touched? Her last rework changed her stealth mechanic, shifting it from a minute long stealth ability to her passive, and removing the slow on leaving stealth and replaced her stealth active ability (W) with a refresh-on-kill movement speed burst ability, gave her Hate Spike a line of damage instead of damaging the two nearest targets who had to be pretty damn nearby, and changed her ultimate from a refresh-on-kill movement speed/Atk Speed buff with a heal on kill to an AoE damage ult with a slow that gives her a shield based on how many people she landed it on. 

That's a pretty goddamn big change to claim they didn't touch her kit on from her rework.
This was before my time, I believe. I don't know when this happened. I've played since 2012 and I haven't heard of this.

Ah, if it was before your time then you missed out on some truly amazing hatred of a company made character. 

It was fantastic. You think the Morello's statement about Poppy ("If she is ever viable in tournament play, she will receive nerfs.") was bad, you should have seen pre-rework Eve. She was nerfed straight into a 6 foot deep hole and left there until the rework. And unlike Poppy who can be used in niche lane match-ups (Mundo, as I believe was shown earlier this year) Eve had absolutely no favorable matchups, period, thanks to how badly Riot nerfed her because of how badly their perception of her was. This was a champion the company themselves made and they hated her so much they nerfed her out of absolutely everything after their nerfs (including skins, free week, etc).

Twitch only gained a huge VU

No.  60 seconds of stealth to 10 seconds is huge.
yep, they reduced it to 2/15's of its original value, but 8 seconds is still plenty long to come in from out of sight, assassinate someone with ult/runaan's and run away like all get out
This boils down to you being impatient so whatever.

3 years for concept-making. Confirmed by RiotScruffy.

Let that sink in.

Not mad at him specifically, just agitated by the way Yorick is apparently being handled: like a piece of garbage no one wants.
I main him and enjoy him, I don't care as long as he ends up okay. Instead of complaining start suggesting rework ideas, you can't force creativity.

It's been 3 years. There's a difference between forcing creativity, and getting results. Are you telling me you couldn't come up with a concept for a Yorick re-work in 3 years? We could probably come up with hundreds of iterations of Yorick in 3 years. Other people already HAVE posted their iterations of a Yorick re-work.

Telling me to "suggest ideas" to a 3-year concept-stage sounds stupid on its own. [This guy already gave his skit in a greatly detailed rework idea](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/opeQPN8s-necromancer-summoner-yorick-kit-rework), and it's probably one of the better rework concepts covering Necromancy that's been around.

Or is sitting around for 3 years coming up with ideas sound productive to you?

You are really desperate to rush this, if they don't think a concept is good enough they aren't going to do it, and that is fine.

I rather they didn't half ass a rework on a concept they don't like just because some people are being impatient.

You also make the assumption they have spent 3 years working on his rework, no one ever said they started 3 years ago, priorities change and Yorick wasn't seen as a huge project back in 2012 like he is now. 

Yorick isn't the only outdated useless champion, just wait your turn.

You are willfully missing the point of my post that the OP quoted.
And to reference your "he only has a 0.81% pick rate" gee, could that be because he is banned in competitive due to numerous known and unknown bugs so esports fans never see him, or perhaps it's because he is permabanned from the freeweek rotation so the only way to play him is to just buy him on a whim?
No one here cares about his kit or his visuals, this thread is about how he won't get skins because he's in queue for a rework practically since his release, and how he is so horribly bugged he breaks the game every other patch.
